data.title: Zettai Renai!
data.meta_description: Posts about Satou Takuya written by Zettai Renai
data.text:
Hello & Welcome!

Wow apologies for disappearing for like two months. Who knows what I’ve been doing because it certainly wasn’t playing games, oops~

That being said, I did play a few so let’s go through them:

I firstly finished the Doukyuusei 2 remake – the latter routes were pretty underwhelming so, despite some improvements, I preferred the first game overall. Probably because the protagonist had more flair.

Next up was something short and overwhelmingly sweet – Boku to Kanojo no Kojin Lesson 2. It’s a very solid pure-love moege with a likable heroine and I couldn’t really ask for much more from this.

I finally then got around to playing Kiniro Loveriche, a Saga Planet game that has been on my backlog for a WHILE. While not my absolute favourite game from them, I did enjoy it a lot (especially Ria’s route). Sylvie is too cute~ Similarly to Anmitsu the 3P scenes were pretty out of place though.

Despite being SUPER hyped for Hooksoft’s newest game Secret Love (Kari) I ended up dropping it after 2 routes. It’s just bad and utterly lacking any vibrancy or soul. All I can say is the art was nice?

To cheer me up I played Nanaka Mai’s doujin title Nagaruboshi. For a super cheap game it was pretty decent. The story was simple but the artwork was great and heroine Mikoto was ADORABLE. A must play for Ogura Yui fans.

I’m currently playing Select Obliege – it’s my first MadoSoft title and it is okay so far. I’ve only put like 5 hours into it though so I don’t have strong opinions yet. The heroine designs and artwork are delightful though!

August’s games have been ordered already – it’s a double Azarashi Soft month so I’ll get my fix (and more points for my nexton account lmao). Kira Kano being a collaboration with Lump of Sugar is pretty much my dream game so I hope it delivers.

Despite trying to resist, I did end up buying just a “few” games from the various Fanza sales. The Nitroplus one in particular was pretty nice.

I’ll have a short blog anniversary post up this weekend & a review of Lovepical Poppy up next week. After that maybe another mini-review collection, who knows?
